meanings.definition: A member of a Native American people inhabiting the southwestern United States.
meanings.sent1: The apaches lived in the southwestern United States.
meanings.sent2: Many apaches were skilled hunters and gatherers.
meanings.sent3: The apaches threw a big feast to celebrate the harvest.
meanings.sent4: The spirit of the apache warrior lived on in their descendants.
meanings.sent5: The colorful clothing of the apaches caught the eye of many travelers.

meanings.sent1: The apaches in Paris were known for their daring heists.
meanings.sent2: The police were on the lookout for the notorious apaches.
meanings.sent3: The apaches caused chaos in the city with their antics.
meanings.sent4: The apaches ruled the criminal underworld with an iron fist.
meanings.sent5: The apaches' hideout was a mysterious place shrouded in secrecy.
